description: Concatenation of first n numbers in base 6.
comments: The first three primes in this sequence occur for n = 11 (N = 4060073996291), n = 43 (N approx 4.3194 x 10^68), n = 173 (N approx 1.3014 x 10^372) (email from Kurt Foster, Oct 24 2015). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 25 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
mathematica: If[STARTPOINT==1, n={}, n=Flatten[IntegerDigits[Range[STARTPOINT-1], 6]]]; Table[AppendTo[n, IntegerDigits[w, 6]]; n=Flatten[n]; FromDigits[n, 6], {w, STARTPOINT, ENDPOINT}] [From _Dylan Hamilton_, Aug 11 2010]Table[FromDigits[Flatten[IntegerDigits[#,6]&/@Range[n]],6],{n,20}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 29 2012 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n eq 1 select 1 else Self(n-1)*6^(1+Ilog(6, n))+n: n in [1..20]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 30 2012
author: _Patrick De Geest_, May 15 1999.
